title: Combustion rxn enthalpy - q for ethane vs propanol

content.question: In an experiment, <math alttext="30.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of ethane and <math alttext="30.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of propanol are placed in separate reaction vessels. Each compound undergoes complete combustion with excess <math alttext="O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following best compares the quantity of heat released in each combustion reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="q sub ethane is less than q sub propanol" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>h</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="q sub ethane is equal to q sub propanol" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>h</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="q sub ethane is greater than q sub propanol" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>h</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
The quantities of heat released in the combustions of ethane and propanol cannot be compared without knowing the specific heat capacity of the compounds.

content.answer: <math alttext="q sub ethane is greater than q sub propanol" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>h</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
